title: 114_hr852
content: The Act may be cited as the "Transparency in Phone Solicitation Act of 2015" or the "TIPS Act of 2015". It establishes technical and procedural standards. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions for live telephone solicitation and the option for recipients to opt out of receiving calls through a designated website. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions for live telephone solicitations, requiring caller identification information to be transmitted, including the identity of the caller and a return call number. The Commission will set standards for live telephone solicitations, requiring clear identification of the caller and providing contact information during the call. The business making telephone solicitations must provide a way for the called party to opt out and should transmit caller identification information including their identity and a return call number. The business making telephone solicitations must provide a way for the called party to opt out and release the called party's line within 5 seconds of hanging up. Live telephone solicitation is defined as a telephone solicitation where the business or entity directly returns the call. The Federal Communications Commission must create regulations within 180 days of the enactment of the Act regarding telephone solicitations that do not use artificial or prerecorded voices and do not have a personal relationship with the called party.
